data.title: My Geekdom
data.meta_description: 5 posts published by CM Towns during February 2021
data.text:
February 14th-Longshot from 2019 (Director: Jonathan Levine, Writers: Dan Sterling and Liz Hannah, Stars: Seth Rogen and Charlize Theron, Cinematography: Yves Bélanger, Runtime: 124 mins) This was good. Not great, but good. The performances were my favorite thing. [Trailer] February … Continue reading →

February 7th-Framing Britney Spears from 2021 (Director: Samantha Stark, Writers: Liz Day, Runtime: 75 mins) From my Letterboxd entry I very much remember watching TMZ during Britney’s mental breakdown. In the years since I’ve felt sick with myself about how … Continue reading →

Top 10 for The Month 1. The Kid Detective (2020-Canada) 2. Casino Royale (2006-UK)* 3. Skyfall (2012-UK)* 4. Burn Bitch Burn (1962-UK)* 5. License to Kill (1989-UK) 6. When Harry Met Sally (1989-US) 7. Tight Spot (1955-US) 8. Rope (1948-US)* … Continue reading →

February 1st-Love and Basketball from 2000 (Director/Writer: Gina Prince-Bythewood, Stars: Sanaa Lathan and Omar Epps, Cinematography: Reynaldo Villalobos, Runtime: 125 mins) The 2000 modest hit turned classic (no, not a cult classic) tells the story of neighbors, best friends, and … Continue reading →

January 23rd-Groundhogs Day from 1993 (Director/Writer: Harold Ramis with co-writer Danny Rubin, Stars: Bill Murray, Cinematography: John Bailey, Runtime: 101 mins) The new season of Unspooled has made me watch another contemporary classic I was looking to avoid for the … Continue reading →
